info.name: Monk
info.description: The Monk class from the 2024 Player’s Handbook.
info.author: Wizards of the Coast

description.p: Monks use rigorous combat training and mental discipline to align themselves with the multiverse and focus their internal reservoirs of power. Different Monks conceptualize this power in various ways: as breath, energy, life force, essence, or self, for example. Whether channeled as a striking display of martial prowess or as a subtler manifestation of defense and speed, this power infuses all that a Monk does.

Monks focus their internal power to create extraordinary, even supernatural effects. They channel uncanny speed and strength into their attacks, with or without the use of weapons. In a Monk's hands, even the most basic weapons can become sophisticated implements of combat mastery.

Many Monks find that a structured life of ascetic withdrawal helps them cultivate the physical and mental focus they need to harness their power. Other Monks believe that immersing themselves in the vibr a nt confusion of life helps to fuel their determination and discipline.

Monks generally view adventures as tests of their physical and mental development. They are driven by a desire to accomplish a greater mission than merely slaying monsters and plundering treasure; they strive to turn themselves into living weapons.

sheet.description: A master of martial arts, harnessing the power of the body in pursuit of physical and spiritual perfection.

setters.set: A master of martial arts, harnessing the power of the body in pursuit of physical and spiritual perfection.

description.p: While you are wearing no armor and not wielding a shield, your AC equals 10 + your Dexterity modifier + your Wisdom modifier.

sheet.description: While you are wearing no armor and not wielding a shield, your AC equals {{ac:unarmored defense monk}}.

description.p: Your practice of martial arts gives you mastery of combat styles that use unarmed strikes and monk weapons, which are Simple Melee weapons, as well as Martial Melee weapons with the Light property.
You gain the following benefits while you are unarmed or wielding only monk weapons and you aren’t wearing armor or wielding a shield:

ul.li: You can use Dexterity instead of Strength for the attack and damage rolls of your unarmed strikes and monk weapons.
You can use Dexterity in place of Strength when determining your save DC for Grappling or Shoving.
You can roll a d6 in place of the normal damage of your unarmed strike or monk weapon. This die changes as you gain monk levels, as shown in the Martial Arts column of the Monk table.
You can make an unarmed strike as a bonus action on your turn.

sheet.description: You can use Strength or Dexterity for your unarmed strikes. Your unarmed strike does 1d{{martial arts:dice}}+{{martial arts:damage}} damage. You can use Dexterity in place of Strength when you Grapple or Shove. Your Grappling or Shoving DC is {{shove or grapple}}. You can make an unarmed strike as a bonus action on your turn.

description.p: Your focus and martial training allow you to harness a well of extraordinary energy within yourself. This energy is represented by Focus Points. Your Monk level determines the number of points you have, as shown in the Focus Points column of the Monk Features table.

You can spend these points to empower various focus features. You start knowing three such features: Flurry of Blows, Patient Defense, and Step of the Wind. You learn more Monk's Focus features as you gain levels in this class.
When you spend a focus point, it is unavailable until you finish a short or long rest, at the end of which you regain all of your expended focus points.
Some of your focus features require your target to make a saving throw to resist the feature’s effects. The saving throw DC is calculated as follows:

center.p: Focus save DC = 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Wisdom modifier

description.p: You can spend 1 focus point to make two unarmed strikes as a bonus action.
You can Disengage action as a bonus action. Alternatively, you can expend 1 focus point to take both the Disengage and the Dodge actions as a bonus action.

You can take the Dash action as a bonus action. Alternatively, you can expend 1 Focus Point to take both the Disengage and Dash actions as a bonus action, and your jump distance is doubled for the turn

You can spend 1 focus point to make three unarmed strikes.

description.p: You can Disengage action as a bonus action. You can spend 1 focus point to also take the Dodge action as part of the bonus action.

sheet.description: You can take the Disengage action as a bonus action. You can spend 1 focus point to also take the Dodge action as part of the bonus action.

You can take the Disengage action as a bonus action. You can spend 1 focus point to also take the Dodge action as part of the bonus action. When you expend a focus point for this feature, it grants you Temporary Hit Points equal to 2d{{martial arts:dice}}.

description.p: You can take the Dash action as a bonus action. You can spend 1 focus point to also take the Disengage action and have your jump distance doubled for the turn as part of the bonus action.

sheet.description: You can take the Dash action as a bonus action. You can spend 1 focus point to also take the Disengage action and have your jump distance doubled for the rest of the your turn as part of the bonus action.

You can take the Dash action as a bonus action. You can spend 1 focus point to also take the Disengage action and have your jump distance doubled for the rest of the your turn as part of the bonus action. When you expend a focus point for this feature, you can move one willing creature with you on your move this turn.

description.p: Your speed increases by 10 feet while you are not wearing armor or wielding a shield. This bonus increases when you reach certain monk levels, as shown in the Monk Features table.

sheet.description: Your speed increases by {{monk:unarmored movement}} feet while you are not wearing armor or wielding a shield.

description.p: When you roll Initiative, you can regain all expended Focus Points. When you do so, roll your Martial Arts die, and regain a number of Hit Points equal to your Monk level plus the number rolled.
Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a Long Rest.

sheet.description: Once per Long Rest, regain all Focus Points when you roll Initiative, and regain 1d{{martial arts:dice}}+{{uncanny metabolism:hp}} Hit Points.

description.p: When you reach 3rd level, you commit yourself to a monastic tradition, such as the Way of the Open Hand. Your tradition grants you features at 3rd level and again at 6th, 11th, and 17th level.

When an attack roll hits you and its damage includes Bludgeoning Piercing or Slashing damage, you can take a reaection to reduce the attack's total damage against you. The reduction equals 1d1 plus your Dexterity modifier and Monk level.

If you reduce the damage to 0, you can expend 1 Focus Point to redirectsome of the attack's force. If you do so, choose a creature you can see within 5 feet of yourself if the attack was a melee attack or a creature you can see within 60 feet of yourseelf that isn't behind total cover if the attack was a ranged attack. That creature must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or take damage equal to two rolls of your Martial Arts die plus your Dexterity modifier. The damage is the same type dealt by the attack.

sheet.description: You can use your reaction to reduce the damage of melee or ranged attacks that deal Bludgeoning, Piercing, or Slashing damage by 1d10+{{monk:deflect attacks bonus}}. If you reduce the damage to 0, you can spend 1 Focus Point to redirect damage. Melee attacks can be directed at a creature within 5 feet, while ranged against a creature within 60 feet. The target must succeed on a DC{{ki:dc}} Dexterity saving throw or takes damage equal to 2d{{monk:deflect attack damage}}+{{monk:deflect attack damage modifier}}.

You can use your reaction to reduce the damage of any melee or ranged attacks by 1d10+{{monk:deflect attacks bonus}}. If you reduce the damage to 0, you can spend 1 Focus Point to redirect damage. Melee attacks can be directed at a creature within 5 feet, while ranged against a creature within 60 feet. The target must succeed on a DC{{ki:dc}} Dexterity saving throw or take damage equal to 2d{{monk:deflect attack damage}}+{{monk:deflect attack damage modifier}}.

description.p: You gain the Ability Score Improvement feat (see chapter S) or another feat of your choice for which you qualify. You gain this feature again at Monk levels 8, 12, and 16
You can use your reaction when you fall to reduce any falling damage you take by an amount equal to five times your monk level.

sheet.description: Reduce any falling damage you take by {{monk:slowfall}}.

description.p: Beginning at 5th level, you can attack twice, instead of once, whenever you take the Attack action on your turn.

sheet.description: You can attack twice, instead of once, whenever you take the Attack action on your turn.

description.p: Once per turn when you hit a creature with a Monk weapon or an Unarmed Strike, you can expend 1 Focus Point to attempt a stunning strike. The target must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the target has the Stunned condition until the start of your next turn. On a successful save, the target's Speed is halved until the start of your next turn, and the next attack roll made against the target before then has Advantage.

sheet.description: When you hit another creature with a Monk weapon or Unarmed Strike, you can spend 1 focus point to attempt a stunning strike. The target must succeed on a DC{{ki:dc}} Constitution saving throw or be stunned until the start of your next turn. On a successful save, the target's Speed is halved, and the next attack against them has Advantage. You can only use Stunning Strike once per turn.

description.p: Whenever you deal damage with your Unarmed Strike, it can deal your choice of Force damage or its normal damage type.

sheet.description: You can choose to deal Force damage instead of Bludgeoning damage for your Unarmed Strikes.

description.p: When you're subjected to an effect that allows you to make a Dexterity saving throw to take only half damage, you instead take no damage if you succeed on the saving throw and only half damage if you fail.
You don't benefit from this feature if you have the Incapacitated condition.

sheet.description: When you are subjected to an effect that allows you to make a Dexterity saving throw to take only half damage and you do not have the Incapacitated condition, you instead take no damage if you succeed on the saving throw, and only half damage if you fail.

description.p: While you are not wearing armor or wielding a shield, you gain the ability to move along vertical surfaes and across liquids on your turn without falling during the movement.

sheet.description: You can move across vertical surfaces and across liquids on your turn while you are not wearing armor or wielding a shield.

description.p: Your Flurry of Blows, Patient Defense and Step of the Wind features gain the following beenefits;
description.li: Flurry of Blows You can expend 1 Focus Point to use Flurry of Blows and make three Unarmed Strikes with it instead of two.
Patient Defense When you expend a Focus Point to use Patient Defense, you gain a number of Temporary Hit Points equal to two rolls of your Martial Arts die.

Step of the Wind When you expend a Focus Point to use Step of the Wind, you can choose a willing creature within 5 feet of yourself that is Large or smaller. You move the creature with you until the end of your turn. The creature's movement doesn't provoke Opportunity Attacks.

description.p: Through sheer force of will. you can remove one of the following conditions from yourself at the end of each of your turns: Charmed, Frightened or Poisoned.
In addition, forgoing food and drink doesn't give you levels of Exhaustion.

sheet.description: You no longer need food or drink to survive and dont suffer exhaustion from the lack of it. Additionally, the Charmed, Frightened and Poisoned automatically end at the end of your turn.

description.p: You can now use your Deflect Attacks feature against attacks that deal any damage type, not just Bludgeoning, Piercing, or Slashing.
Your physical and mental discipline grant you proficiency in all saving throws.
Additionally, whenever you make a saving throw and fail, you can spend 1 focus point to reroll it and take the second result.

sheet.description: Whenever you make a saving throw and fail, you can spend 1 focus point to reroll it and take the second result.

description.p: If you haven't used Uncanny Metabolism since your last long rest and have fewer than 4 Focus Points, you regain 4 Focus Points when rolling Initiative.

sheet.description: If you don’t use Uncanny Metabolism and have fewer than 4 Focus Points, go back up to 4 Focus Points when rolling Initiative.

description.p: At the start of your turn, you can expend 3 Focus Points to bolster yourself against harm for 1 min- ute or until you have the Incapacitated condition. During that time, you have Resistance to all damage except Force damage.

sheet.description: You can spend 3 Focus Points at the start of your turn to gain resistance to all damage types except Force for 1 minute.

description.p: You gain an Epic Boon feat or another feat of your choice for which you qualify.
You have developed your body and mind to new heights. Your Dexterity and Wisdom scores increase by 4, to a maximum of 25.

sheet.description: You embody the power of the wilds. Your Wisdom and Dexterity scores increase by 4. Your maximum for those scores is now 25.
